description.raw:
Issue #1570 happens because it is possible to get `GLWidget` to keep publishing and subscribing to selection messages in a loop. 

An easy way to reproduce this is to insert a Rag Doll in the scene and then double click it. If you click fast enough you'll see bounding boxes blinking uncontrolably, sometimes Gazebo even crashes. You can even check the messages being circularly published with `gz topic -e /gazebo/default/selection`.

After talking to @nkoenig about this, we thought it would be a nice idea to stop subscribing to selection messages from the client side, but keep on publishing them. This means clients won't get selection messages from other clients for example, so they can't see each other's selections. Which is probably something which shouldn't be happening right now, since gzclient doesn't really support collaboration yet.

For reference, publishing selection messages was introduced on pull request #1318. Publishing will be maintained, only subscribing is being removed.

I also removed `hoverVis` from `GLWidget` since it isn't used.

This should also close issue #1523
